description.narrative: The development objective of the Project is to achieve further improvements in efficiency, taxpayer services, and tax compliance through capacity building and systems improvement in the Croatian Tax Administration (CTA). This will be accomplished by supporting the development of a strategic plan for tax modernization and assisting in its implementation over the next five years. This investment will move the tax administration closer toward harmonization of its policies and operations with EU accession expectations.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :L.A. Schedule 2, Section II, B. 3 | Description :Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisionof Section 5.09 (b) of the General Conditions. Each shall shall covert he period of one fiscal year of the Borrower, | Frequency:Yearly
Finance Agreement :L.A., Article V, Paragraph 5.01 (d) | Description :CTA has employed the Assistant Director of its HumanResources and Training Department | Due Date :31-Dec-2007

Finance Agreement :L.A., Article V, Paragraph 5.01 (a) | Description :The Borrower has established the Committee for the StrategicManagement of the Project in a manner satisfactory to the Bank | Due Date :31-Dec-2007
Finance Agreement :L.A., Article V, Paragraph 5.01 (b) | Description :CTA has established the Project Implementation Committee in amanner satisfactory to the Bank | Due Date :31-Dec-2007
Finance Agreement :L.A., Article V, Paragraph 5.01 (c) | Description :CTA has established the Project Implementation Unit in amanner satisfactory to the Bank | Due Date :31-Dec-2007
Finance Agreement :L.A., Article V, Paragraph 5.01 (e) | Description :CTA has adopted the Project Operational Manual, satisfactoryto the Bank | Due Date :31-Dec-2007
Finance Agreement :L.A., Article V, Paragraph 5.01 (f) | Description :The Borrower and CTA have adopted the Strategic Plan for CTAModernization, satisfactory to the Bank | Due Date :31-Dec-2007

Finance Agreement :L.A., Schedule 2, Section II, B. 2 | Description :prepare and furnish to the Bank not later than 45 days afterthe end of each calendar quarter, interim un-audited financial reportsc overing the quarter, in form and substance satisfactory tothe Bank | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :L.A., Schedule 2, Section II, B.1 | Description :The Borrower, through CTA, shall maintain or cause to bemaintained a financial management system in accordance with the provisionso f Section 5.09 of the General Conditions | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A 11 | Description :About 18 months after the Effective Date, the Borrower, through MOFand CTA, shall carry out, jointly with the Bank, a midterm revie w of the progress made in carrying out the Project | Due Date:18-Dec-2009

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.1 | Description :The Borrower shall maintain the Committee for the Strategic Managementof the Project during Project implementation, with a composit ion and terms of reference acceptable to the Bank | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.10 | Description :Not later than 12 months after the Effective Date, the Borrower,through CTA, shall complete an evaluation report of the Zagreb reg ional tax office and the large tax payer office | Due Date:31-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.3 | Description :during Project implementation, the Borrower shall ensure that CTAmaintains a Project Coordinator with terms of reference and perfor mance acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.4 | Description :the Borrower shall ensure, through CTA, that, during Projectimplementation, the Project Implementation Unit is maintained with adeq uate staffing and resources. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.5 | Description :The Borrower, through CTA, shall take all necessary measures toimplement the Project in accordance with the Project Operational Man ual and the EMP | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.6 | Description :(i) all measures necessary under the EMP are carried out in a timelymanner; and (ii) adequate information on the implementation oft he said measures is suitably included in the Project Reports |Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.7 | Description :The Borrower shall ensure that its annual budget provides forsufficient funds for the operating and maintenance costs of the facili ties and buildings to be rehabilitated or constructed |Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.8 | Description :Not later than six (6) months after new legislation on civil servicesalaries is effective, the Borrower shall take all appropriatem easures, satisfactory to the Bank, to adjust salaries for CTA staff| Due Date :31-Dec-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, A.9 | Description :Not later than six (6) months after new legislation on TIN iseffective, the Borrower shall take all appropriate measures, satisfact ory to the Bank, to begin introduction of TIN | Due Date:30-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV, paragraph B.1 (b) | Description :No Loan withdrawal shall be made regarding Component 3of the project unless new legislation on TIN, satisfactory to the Bank, has b een enacted | Due Date :30-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section1, A.2 | Description :The Borrower, through CTA, shall maintain the Project ImplementationCommittee during Project implementation, with a composition and terms of reference acceptable to the Bank | Frequency :Monthly
